intro: Knautia subscaposa subsp. subscaposa, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing clusters of tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and slopes. The subspecies is distinguished by its shorter, more compact stems compared to other subspecies within the species.
